intro: Moraea framesii, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a South African native plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, sturdy stem. Moraea framesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is well-suited to Mediterranean climates.
